bioghist.p: Faith Paulette Dreher (1945-1979) was a 1967 graduate of Bryn Mawr College. She received master's of art history and philosophy degrees and a doctorate in northern baroque painting from Columbia University. As a graduate student she taught at Columbia University and Barnard College, and served as a consultant to Harvard's Fogg Museum, the Metropolitan Museum in New York, and other institutions. She was involved with the League of Women Voters in Philadelphia, serving for a time as that organization's president. At the time of her death from leukemia in 1979, she was a curator at the Deshong Museum of Widener University.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the diaries of Faith Paulette Dreher. Between 1960 and 1979, Dreher kept a daily journal, filling several volumes per year. She discusses all aspects of her life: friends, family, work, politics, and current events. The collection also includes a course notebook on baroque painting, and a copy of Dreher's 1975 doctoral dissertation, entitled The Vision of Country Life in the Paintings of David Teniers II.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
